benchmark_details.name: VidTFS (Training-Free Video Goals and Action Inference Framework)
benchmark_details.overview: VidTFS is a training-free, open-vocabulary framework for video goal inference and action recognition, using frozen visual foundational models and large language models with dynamic frame selection.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate video goal inference and action recognition without requiring any training.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Performance may degrade when LLMs exhibit hallucinations without clear logical reasoning.

data.source: Various public video datasets including UCF101, ActivityNet, CrossTask, and COIN.
data.annotation: Visual frame captions generated by BLIP-2 model.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on how well the generated inferences match the ground truths across various tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment of generated hypotheses with ground truth.
methodology.baseline_results: VidTFS outperforms existing state-of-the-art methods on multiple tasks.
methodology.validation: Results validated against widely accepted benchmarks.

targeted_risks.harm: The framework may inaccurately identify actions or goals due to LLM behavior.
